Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with an angular shoulder, decorated on the discus with Isis suckling the child Horus, seated on a throne flanked by elephant's tusks. There are three raised points at the nozzle. At the rear is an Egyptian ring handle. Within the base-ring is a central impressed point. Covered on the upper side with an orange-red slip.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q2040)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Mrs W N Weech
